titleStmt.title: Londini status pacatus: or, Londons peaceable estate Exprest in sundry triumphs, pageants, and shewes, at the innitiation of the right Honourable Henry Garvvay, into the Majoralty of the famous and farre renowned city London. All the charge and expence, of the laborious projects both by water and land, being the sole undertakings of the Right Worshipfull Society of Drapers. Written by Thomas Heyvvood.
titleStmt.author: Heywood, Thomas, d. 1641.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University. Library.
